intro: Camptoloma canariense, commonly known as the Canary Islands bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has linear to lanceolate leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
